metadata.Title: CVE-2022-46872 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An attacker who compromised a content process could have partially escaped the sandbox to read arbitrary files via clipboard-related IPC messages.
*This bug only affects Thunderbird for Linux. Other operating systems are unaffected.*. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 108, Firefox ESR < 102.6, and Thunderbird < 102.6. Update Instructions: Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-46872` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: firefox - 108.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1 firefox-geckodriver - 108.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1 firefox-mozsymbols - 108.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1 No subscription required thunderbird - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1 thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1 thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1 xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1 xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1 xul-ext-lightning - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1 No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine mdeslaur> starting with Ubuntu 22.04, the firefox package is just a script that installs the Firefox snap

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '108.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
mozjs52 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs68 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
thunderbird package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
